Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body and handle of a pale-red pottery wine-jar with convex body and large, applied handle, the fabric contains a number of small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and the top of the handle is impressed with a stamp-mark imperfectly applied from a stamp giving the text 'house of Aten in Iunu (= Heliopolis)' in a double oval.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:26/265 The North Suburb, South Eastern Quarter, V.36.1
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393445) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393445)
